summary:
Brisbane Weather Forecast, India vs Australia 3rd Test: Can Rain Save India From Humiliation At The Gabba?

Date: December 16, 2024

Source: News18

India's chances of leading in the 2024-25 Border-Gavaskar Trophy are at risk as rain threatens to interrupt play at the Gabba. After 33.1 overs, Australia dominated Day 3, leaving India in a tough spot with 51/4.

  • Forecast for Days 4 and 5 predicts better weather but with possible interruptions due to showers.
  • India struggled on Day 3, losing four top-order batsmen quickly.
  • Rain may favor India by keeping a draw as a viable outcome.
  • Showers are expected early morning and in the evening on Tuesday.
  • Thunderstorms could impact the final day of the Test on Wednesday.
“Usually, rains are the enemy of a batting team as continuous breaks hamper the concentration built over many overs. In India’s case, it might be a friend.”

India will aim to maximize playing time to avoid a follow-on and sustain a glimmer of hope in the Test.
newTitle: Brisbane Weather Forecast: India vs Australia 3rd Test - Can Rain Save India From Humiliation?

summary:
World Chess Championship: Chennai comes out in big numbers to welcome its newest hero Gukesh

Date: December 16, 2024 Source: Indian Express

Chennai erupted in celebration as D. Gukesh returned after being crowned the youngest world chess champion. The reception was marked by fans, students, and media frenzy at the airport.

  • Gukesh wore his winner's medal and held the championship trophy upon his arrival.
  • His homecoming included a guard of honour from students of his alma mater.
  • An overwhelming crowd of supporters created chaos at the airport.
  • The Sports Development Authority of Tamil Nadu played a crucial role in his journey to becoming champion.
“My dream was to become the youngest world champion. I am very happy to achieve this goal and come home,” Gukesh said.

Despite the celebrations, Gukesh remains humble and focused on further improvement.

title: 'Virat Kohli brought this upon himself...': Gavaskar admits 'worrying' signs over India great's repetitive dismissals - Hindustan Times
summary:
Gavaskar Expresses Concern Over Kohli's Repetitive Dismissals

Date: Dec 16, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Virat Kohli continues to struggle with wide deliveries in Test cricket, facing criticism for his dismissals. Experts like Sunil Gavaskar comment on his need for greater discipline at the crease.

  • Kohli was dismissed for just 3 runs in the first innings of the Brisbane Test.
  • His dismissal came while chasing a wide delivery from Josh Hazlewood, leading to India being 22/3.
  • Gavaskar criticizes Kohli's eagerness to chase deliveries outside the off-stump.
  • He advises Kohli to take his time and not play aggressively too early in his innings.
  • Kohli scored a century in the first Test but has struggled in subsequent innings.
“In the earlier three dismissals, there was nothing wrong. (But) this one, he brought this upon himself because he could've left that ball well alone.” - Sunil Gavaskar

The ongoing struggles of Virat Kohli raise concerns about his form and adaptability against quality seam bowling.
newTitle: Gavaskar Expresses Concern Over Kohli's Repetitive Dismissals

title: Hayden's ‘brotherly’ advice for struggling Rohit Sharma with two ‘trigger words’: 'I'd be saying to him as his partner…' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Hayden's Key Advice to Rohit Sharma: Focus on Intent and Energy

Date: December 16, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Legendary Australian cricketer Matthew Hayden has shared crucial advice aimed at helping Indian captain Rohit Sharma regain his batting form. Hayden emphasizes the need for Rohit to bring back his positive intent and energy in his game, especially after a recent struggle with form in red-ball cricket.

  • Rohit has struggled recently, averaging just 11.83 in his last 12 innings.
  • He has sacrificed his opening position for KL Rahul in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • Hayden suggests that Rohit needs to focus on being reactive rather than defensive.
  • He mentions that 'intent' and 'energy' are key 'trigger words' for Rohit.
"When I think of Rohit Sharma, I think of a free-scoring batsman... For purely Rohit Sharma's sake, he needs to have a great intent and energy about him." - Matthew Hayden

In conclusion, Hayden believes that by focusing on intent and energy, Rohit can regain his batting rhythm and confidence, which will ultimately benefit the team.
newTitle: Hayden's Key Advice to Rohit Sharma: Focus on Intent and Energy

title: 'Can't have mindset of pointing fingers at each other': Jasprit Bumrah - The Times of India
summary:
'Can't have mindset of pointing fingers at each other': Jasprit Bumrah

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

India's vice-captain Jasprit Bumrah emphasized that the team should not blame each other during their transition phase, despite a disappointing performance in the Brisbane Test.

  • Bumrah has taken 18 wickets in the ongoing Border Gavaskar Trophy.
  • India is currently level in the series against Australia at 1-1.
  • The team struggled in their batting response, collapsing to 51 for 4 against Australia's first-innings total of 445.
  • Bumrah supports his fellow bowlers and focuses on teamwork.
  • He acknowledges the team's inexperience compared to past tours.
"We don't want to get into that mindset where we're pointing fingers at each other," stated Bumrah. "As a bowling unit, we are in transition. So it's my job to help others. I have played a little more than them, so I am trying to help them."

The Indian team aims to build partnerships as they continue their fight on the field amidst challenging conditions.
newTitle: 'Can't have mindset of pointing fingers at each other': Jasprit Bumrah

title: 'Not made for the new ball': Ex-India cricketer questions Virat Kohli's technique - The Times of India
summary:
Ex-India Cricketer Questions Virat Kohli's Technique Against New Ball

Date: Monday

Source: Times of India

Former India cricketer Cheteshwar Pujara has raised concerns regarding Virat Kohli's technique against the new ball during the ongoing Gabba Test, asserting that his approach may not adequately address the challenges of facing fresh, moving deliveries.

  • Pujara highlights Kohli's struggle against the new ball, having been dismissed during crucial moments.
  • Kohli scored a century against the old ball but has struggled significantly, with only 26 runs in the remaining innings.
  • Pujara suggests that Kohli needs a mental shift rather than just technical adjustments to improve his performance.
  • All of Kohli's dismissals this series have come from catches to slip or wicketkeeper, pointing to issues in execution and mindset.
“His technique is not made for the new ball... If he plays the new ball, the bowlers are fresh, and their confidence is also high.” - Cheteshwar Pujara

Pujara expresses that Kohli's struggles reflect a need for mental adjustments in addition to his practice, as he has failed to apply learned techniques during matches.
newTitle: Ex-India Cricketer Questions Virat Kohli's Technique Against New Ball

India's batting line-up once again faced collapse against Australia, with reckless shot selection leading to disappointing totals and creating a hole in the Test match on the third day.

title: Why Wolves sacked Gary O’Neil and turned to Jorge Mendes again - The Athletic
summary:
Wolves Fire Gary O’Neil and Reunite with Jorge Mendes

Publication Date: December 15, 2024

Source: The Athletic

The Wolverhampton Wanderers have made a significant change in management, parting ways with Gary O'Neil and bringing back renowned super-agent Jorge Mendes for assistance. This decision comes after a string of unsatisfactory performances and a pressing need to turn the team's fortunes around.

  • Wolves turned to Mendes again, after a two-year hiatus, for assistance after failed attempts to find a suitable replacement for O’Neil.
  • Vitor Pereira is now in contention to take over as head coach, with negotiations underway for his release from Al Shabab.
  • The club faced challenges in securing high-profile managers, prompting reliance on Mendes once again.
  • The decision follows a series of poor results, including a demoralizing defeat to Ipswich Town.
  • O’Neil's management troubled by an injury crisis and squad mismanagement.
  • Mendes’s influence is expected to rise following O’Neil's departure, marking a potential return to a past approach to recruitment.
“Even senior figures at Wolves accepted that O’Neil was to a large extent a victim of circumstance.”

In conclusion, Wolves aim to rejuvenate their season with Vitor Pereira at the helm, relying on Mendes's connections to secure essential players during the upcoming transfer window.
newTitle: Wolves Fire Gary O’Neil and Reunite with Jorge Mendes
